item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza: Best Skills For The Endgame
item.description:
Summary

  • Donkey Kong Bananza feels like Nintendo's open-world hit, with unique powers and skill trees.
  • Bananza Powers like Bananergy and Better Inhaling enhance gameplay, exploration, and combat.
  • Key skills like Better Flutter and Fast Charge are essential for success, especially for the final boss.

Donkey Kong Bananza can easily be compared to Super Mario Odyssey and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild , as the game feels like it was built on Nintendo’s previous open-world powerhouses. The two things Donkey Kong has over Mario and Link from those games are power, as he can destroy the land itself, and a skill tree, which allows him to unlock upgrades.

Donkey Kong Bananza features RPG elements; once players collect five Banandium Gems, Donkey Kong will earn a Skill Point. By the end of the game, there is a particular list of powers that will prove most useful for continuing exploration before and after the final boss. Let’s go through a quick rundown of the best Skills for Donkey Koong Bananza's endgame.

Bananza Powers will be discussed, so players averse to hearing about those may want a Spoiler warning.

7 Bananergy

Make DK’s Bananza Powers Last Longer

DK can transform in Donkey Kong Bananza once players meet one of the five Elders. For example, Kong Bananza can turn DK into a bigger ape who can smash through things, while Zebra Bananza turns him into a zebra and increases his speed. Transforming takes Bananergy, which can be restored by collecting Gold, of which there is plenty in Donkey Kong Bananza .

Unlocking Bananergy in the Skill Tree will make transformations last longer, which is key to exploration and boss fights later in the game. Players may also want to invest in the Melon Juice node on the Skill Tree, as the item, Melon Juice, can restore Bananergy as well.

6 Better Flutter

Glide With Ease

Better Flutter is a skill for the Ostrich Bananza form, which can be DK’s second or third transformation, depending on the path players choose in Donkey Kong Bananza . The big hook of Ostrich Bananza is that it allows DK to fly, and Better Flutter will make sure players won’t plummet to the ground once DK gets tired. There is only one level to this skill, so it’s a good one to buy quickly.

Another good Ostrich Bananza skill that pairs well with Better Flutter is Glide, which does have several levels to unlock. Once players max out Glide, they can fly further after a big jump or by leaping off a tall point on the map.

5 Better Inhaling

Load Up That Trunk With Gold

Better Inhaling is a skill that belongs to the fourth transformation player will unlock, called Elephant Bananza. This elephant-themed form will let players suck up materials around them using DK’s massive trunk, from dirt to lava. Better Inhaling has a few upgrade levels, and when maxed out, the trunk’s sucking range will be increased.

Along with Better Inhaling, players should purchase and complete the Stronger Lungs Skill to make sure DK doesn’t get tired when inhaling all of those materials. Punching through rocks in Donkey Kong Bananza is very fun, just like it is in most destructible open-world games, but players may never want to punch again once they master these two skills for Elephant Bananza.

4 Better Sonar

Make It Easier To Find Treasure

DK’s move set will be quite large even before players unlock the Skill Tree in Donkey Kong Bananza . For example, players can slap the ground, which will do three things. It will make a tiny impression in the earth, it will detect treasure within a small vicinity near DK, and it can gather materials like Gold and Banandium Chips around DK.

Better Sonar is an upgradable skill that can increase the range of DK’s treasure detection, while Better Collecting will gather more materials from further away. Both skills will help players find and retrieve treasure more quickly, which is important if they want to maximize their time in Donkey Kong Bananza .

3 Fast Charge

A Must-Have Ability For The Final Boss

DK’s Kong Bananza form is one of the best Bananza forms in the game, but it doesn't have a lot of good skills that are worthy of upgrading early on. However, the final round of bosses almost forces players to unlock three skills: Charge Punch, Fast Charge , and Kong Armor.

Fast Charge will decrease the amount of time needed to use this form’s special punch ability, Charge Punch will increase that same attack’s aftershock, and Kong Armor will make sure enemies or attacks can’t interrupt the charge. These skills are useful for exploring, too, but they will definitely be needed in the endgame.

2 Health

Increase DK’s Heart Capacity

Health upgrades are part of every major skill tree in almost any game, and Donkey Kong Bananza is no exception. Literally called Health , players can upgrade this node several times to max out DK’s hearts. Players can also gain temporary hearts by resting at Getaways, one of the best uses for Gold in Donkey Kong Bananza .

Two-thirds of the game’s bosses and enemies are not going to give players much trouble, but it’s the latter third that are the problem, as difficulty will increase significantly. Players may also want to pump some Skill Points into the Apple Juice node, so that they can store more of the item they use to heal mid-battle.

1 Punch Power

Dig Deeper, Dig Faster

Each Sublayer of Donkey Kong Bananza's open world has a star rating. The higher the rating, the harder it will be for players (and DK) to punch through the terrain. Punch Power is a skill that players should upgrade as they go through with the game to match the star rating of each Sublayer.

It’s a good early skill to upgrade and a necessary one to maximize by the game's later stages, unless players like watching DK punch the same rock wall a hundred times before it moves an inch.

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games That Sold More Than 10 Million Copies, Ranked
item.description:
Open-world gaming has become a very lucrative genre for companies to participate in. There's a reason why so many AAA developers splurge a ton of money to both develop and market these sandbox titles, hoping to ride the wave of positive critical and commercial reception to sell a large number of units.

This is why the units shipped for certain games can be eye-watering, with fans finding it hard to fathom the sheer number of players who have experienced the magic of these open-world games. For the most part, the amount of love and care put into these games ensures that the high numbers are justified.

8 Cyberpunk 2077

Total Sales: 30 Million

6 Images
6 Images
Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
110
8.9 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, PC
Powered by

Cyberpunk 2077 is one of the greatest open-world RPGs of all time, turning its reputation around after an infamous launch threatened to undo all the good PR CD Projekt Red had generated. Eventually, players could appreciate the amazing narrative of this open-world game that clearly had a ton of love poured into it.

As a result, the reception around CD Projekt Red's game warmed, and Cyberpunk 2077 ended up selling upwards of thirty million units. It's a testament to the studio's never-say-die attitude that they convinced everyone to give this game a shot and a second chance, bolstered by Update 2.0 and the Phantom Liberty expansion.

7 Hogwarts Legacy

Total Sales: 34 Million

Hogwarts Legacy
9 /10
75
8.7 /10
Released
February 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Avalanche Software
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

The power of the Harry Potter IP is incredible, and the fact that Hogwarts Legacy managed to sell so many units on the back of this magical universe's brand appeal alone is a testament to how genre-defining this franchise is.

Despite lacking some innovations to help its open world stand out from other titles in the genre, fans still couldn't get enough of Hogwarts Legacy and flocked to it in droves. The amazing combat and an interactive Harry Potter world were more than enough for players to stick with this title till the very end.

6 The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Total Sales: 34.5 Million

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
46
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Nintendo EPD
Platform(s)
Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2
Powered by

Breath of the Wild is one of the best video games that fans can get their hands on. The innovations it made to the open-world genre were so staggering that it turned into a system seller in no time.

Fans loved Breath of the Wild for its amazing exploration and fun combat, among many other things that helped it stand out from the rest of the pack. With the Switch selling like hotcakes, it's easy to see why this open-world game managed to sell so many units with ease.

5 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Total Sales: 40 Million

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
77
9.4 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim has been re-released so many times that it would be odd not to find it on this list. Bethesda is clearly proud of this game and has done everything in its power to inflate the game's sales numbers as much as possible.

This open-world masterpiece is a blast to play through even now, especially if players download some curated mods to improve the experience. Either way, Skyrim will always let players enjoy a magical time as they take on the role of the Dragonborn and help them save the world.

4 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Total Sales: 60 Million

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
53
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is CD Projekt Red's magnum opus by a country mile. With engrossing European fantasy and a world brimming with interesting characters and monsters, the loyalty surrounding the finale of Geralt's story was one that attracted players new and old for one of the most hyped video games ever made.

It helped that The Witcher 3 delivered on this hype, letting fans enjoy one of the greatest video games ever made that fans can't get enough of to this day. It has sold so many units that it would be hard to find a hardcore gamer who has never heard of this title before.

3 Red Dead Redemption 2

Total Sales: 74 Million

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
164
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
Powered by

Rockstar's work on Red Dead Redemption 2 was out of this world, allowing fans to engage with one of the richest and most beautiful open worlds they could feast their eyes on. Arthur Morgan's adventures are incredible to behold as players embark on the journey of a lifetime with Dutch and his gang.

The emotional storytelling and patented Rockstar polish of this title turned it into a bestseller in no time. It's arguably the best Rockstar game of all time, even if another popular product from this company has sold triple the number of units that this game has.

2 Grand Theft Auto 5

Total Sales: 215 Million

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10

September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

Developer(s)
Rockstar North
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto 5 was already poised to break into the mainstream and sell gangbusters. However, the true contributor to this game's high sales is the revolutionary GTA Online mode that has become way more popular than anyone could've expected.

This has reached a point where the single-player mode of this game isn't the biggest draw. Rather, it's GTA Online that players shell out the big bucks for, causing this title's sales to spike considerably and reach astronomical heights.

1 Minecraft

Total Sales: 300 Million

6 Images
6 Images
Minecraft
182
8.9 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Mojang
Platform(s)
3DS, Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Wii U, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PS Vita, Xbox One, Xbox 360
Powered by

Minecraft is one of the most legendary indie titles of all time. A simple game about survival and crafting became an innovative gaming experience that has inspired many other genres ever since.

It wouldn't be a stretch that games with survival and crafting gameplay loops owe a lot of their success to Minecraft , the game that started it all. The sheer pop culture appeal of Minecraft contributed to a ton of sales, eventually leading to Microsoft paying the big bucks to acquire this IP for themselves.

item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza: Every Kong In The Game, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • New Kongs in Donkey Kong Bananza grant special powers to DK, enhancing gameplay.
  • Cranky Kong appears with Rambi in a supporting role, giving DK a Banandium Gem.
  • Diddy and Dixie Kong challenge DK to a race in Racing Layer, but could be better utilized.

Donkey Kong Bananza is a fresh start for Donkey Kong. It isn’t a spinoff of the Donkey Kong Country games, and it isn’t a sequel to Donkey Kong 64 . That said, there are plenty of callbacks to both of those games, including cameos from other Kongs beyond Donkey Kong himself.

There are new Kongs in the game too, who appear as villains, which is something new for the series. Overall, players may want to know who appears in Donkey Kong Bananza and how well they are implemented. All the Kongs in Donkey Kong Bananza will be ranked according to how well they are used and how much of an impact they have on the story and gameplay.

Light story Spoilers ahead for Donkey Kong Bananza.

7 Kong Elder

Bananzaaaaa!

There are five mystical Elders in Donkey Kong Bananza who grant DK special transformation abilities. The first one, Kong Elder , gives DK the Kong Bananza form, which turns him into a massive ape who can destroy almost anything with ease. Players need Bananergy to transform, which they can get by collecting Gold throughout the underground world.

These transformations make Donkey Kong Bananza better, and Kong Elder is the only ape-like being of the bunch. Technically, he’s not a Kong, but he is an ape, so it’s worth including him here anyway, as he is a cool character if only for a very limited time. The game doesn’t go into Kong Elder's origins much, and Nintendo will probably never answer any questions regarding them, but it’s best to cover all the bases.

6 Cranky Kong

Little More Than A Series Of Cameos

Technically, Cranky Kong first appeared in 1981 as the titular Donkey Kong in the original Donkey Kong arcade game. After that, he was known as Cranky Kong, the grandfather of the version of Donkey Kong who appeared in Donkey Kong Country . Cranky Kong typically has a supporting role in these games, except for Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze , which made him playable.

That was his greatest adventure, but in Donkey Kong Bananza , he just rambles on about old stories and then gives DK a Banandium Gem at the end. It is nice that Cranky Kong is accompanied by Rambi, though, one of the mounts from Donkey Kong Country .

5 Diddy And Dixie Kong

Could Have Been Better Utilized

Diddy Kong first appeared as DK’s partner in Donkey Kong Country . Dixie Kong , Diddy’s best gal pal, appeared in the sequel, Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy’s Kong Quest , which made Diddy the star. The two are inseparable, as seen in The Super Mario Bros. Movie , so it made sense to pair them up in Donkey Kong Bananza .

They will challenge DK to a race in the Racing Layer, and that’s pretty much it for their contributions to the game. If there were more races, then maybe they would have ranked higher, but Diddy and Dixie Kong are only marginally better utilized than Cranky Kong. Dixie also mentions Candy Kong, DK’s girlfriend who first appeared in Donkey Kong Country , but she never makes an appearance in Donkey Kong Bananza .

4 Poppy Kong

A Business-Centric Ninja

Poppy Kong is a new character in Donkey Kong Bananza and one of Void Kong’s subordinates within Void Company. She’s a company spy who uses potions to turn herself invisible, which is a cool power. Unfortunately, compared to the other new villainous Kongs, Poppy doesn’t get to fight DK as often.

She’s more of a behind-the-scenes sort of corporate ninja, which is cool on paper, but less cool in practice. Plus, she does become an ally later on who helps break DK out of jail. She would make for a great lead character in a Sly Cooper -like spinoff with stealth, platforming, and ninja action, but in Donkey Kong Bananza, she's very middle-of-the-pack.

3 Void Kong

If Goro Majima Was A Monkey

Void Kong is the head of Void Company and the primary villain for most of Donkey Kong Bananza . It’s kind of telling that he is evil, but not smart, as everything he uses is due to Grumpy Kong’s ingenuity, from his remote control to his flying banana. His speech patterns and costume make him look like he belongs in a Yakuza game.

Void Kong is a bit of a try-hard who gets what’s coming to him in the end. He is fun to hate on, though, like a Saturday Morning Cartoon villain, so in that way, he’s a good addition to the Donkey Kong franchise as a whole. In the end, his whereabouts are unknown, so he could return to seek revenge in a sequel or DLC.

2 Grumpy Kong

Let The Man Work

Grumpy Kong is another new Kong in Donkey Kong Bananza who works for Void Kong. He is the technician for Void Company who designed almost every random enemy and boss that players will face. True to his name, Grumpy is not a happy camper, but he does love his work, and he will clash with DK multiple times.

Even though he isn’t the head of Void Company, his mechanical abilities are top-notch, which makes him a bigger threat to DK. Like Poppy, Grumpy also eventually becomes an ally, but his reappearance only happens in the post-game.

1 Donkey Kong

Of Course, The Game’s Titular Character Is Number One

Donkey Kong Bananza is the reboot Donkey Kong needed on many levels. His strength is better showcased, as he never truly got to be a powerhouse in any of his previous games, from Donkey Kong Country to Donkey Kong 64 . Smashing walls in an open-world game has never felt this good before.

Even though he can’t talk, DK’s expressions are fantastic and thoroughly convey how the big ape is feeling. He’s not all muscle, though, as his partnership with Pauline is sweet and a big part of what makes the game sing. Hopefully, DK won’t have to wait this long to be the star of his own video game again.

item.title: Dune Awakening: Where to Find the Landsraad Vendors
item.description:
Dune Awakening's primary endgame activity involves Atredies and Harkonnen guilds completing various quests to earn the favor of the Landsraad. The house manages to earn the most points, wins the Landsraad, and gets access to exclusive vendors and buffs. If your house won this week's Landsraad and gained access to the special vendor, it'll be either the weapons, tools, vehicles, or armor vendor. Here's where to find these vendors in the game.

Where to Find the Landsraad Vendors in Arakeen

Players who belong to a guild that's part of House Atreides should travel to Arakeen to access the Landsraad Vendor in Dune Awakening. You can do that by either flying to the edge of the Hagga Basin and accessing Arakeen in the top-right corner of the World Map, or paying 2500 to an Ornithopter Pilot to fly there.

Either way, once you reach Arakeen, keep going forward and take a left from the central hall. Go past the weapon vendor to your left , and the next room will have all the Landsraad Vendors for you to purchase gear from.

Where to Find the Landsraad Vendors in Harko Village

The Landsraad vendors in Harko Village are located in the upper portion of the area . For that, you'll need to head past the security gates and descend the first staircase ahead. Once you've reached the ground level, take a left turn and run past the Harkonnen soldiers rallying captives.

There's a slope heading to the upper level of Harko Village that you'll need to ascend on. Once you're on the upper floor, keep heading forward and look to the left to enter a room with all the Landsraad vendors. There will also be an Atreides vendor here, in case your guild belongs to the faction.

How to Unlock the Landsraad Vendors in Dune Awakening

As discussed before, you'll need to be a part of a guild and side with either the Harkonnen or Atreides factions to participate in the Landsraad endgame activity in Dune Awakening . Several smaller houses in the Landsraad will have tasks for your guild , which will mostly include donating a certain amount of materials, weapons, armor, or holding a Deep Desert control point.

The faction that accumulates a certain threshold of points first will win that house's favor. The faction that claims the favor of most houses until the next task is revealed will be able to gain access to Landsraad Decrees, which include Landsraad Vendors. You can check which Landsraad terms are available for a week by visiting its menu and switching over to the Decree tab.

item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza: Every Bananza Power, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Zebra Bananza form is limited in use, not the best investment for upgrades in Donkey Kong Bananza .
  • Snake Bananza provides a double jump ability and time slow-down feature for boss fights.
  • Ostrich Bananza offers flight, able to reach high areas, and drop eggs as an attack.

Donkey Kong Bananza is Donkey Kong at his most powerful. It’s wild to see him go from the Donkey Kong Country franchise to this, with a power boost as if he drank Captain America’s Super Soldier serum. Beyond his fists, players can also unlock special abilities throughout the story called Bananza Powers.

With Bananergy, Donkey Kong can transform into a few different animals. For players jumping into Donkey Kong Bananza for the first time, they may not want to be spoiled on these gifts. There will be a warning, but this will be a ranking of all the Bananza Powers in Donkey Kong Bananza featuring how they come into being, how they work, and why they are useful.

Spoilers Ahead for Donkey Kong Bananza.

5 Zebra Bananza

Fleeting Fun

When players make it to the The Divide in Donkey Kong Bananza , they will have a choice. One path will bring them down to the Freezer Layer where they can get the Zebra Bananza form, and the other path will lead them to the Forest Layer where the Ostrich Bananza form awaits. Players should go to the Forest Layer to get the Ostrich Bananza form first, because the Zebra Bananza form doesn’t have a lot of uses. Once transformed, DK will move faster. Certain platforms will crumble if players move on them too slowly, which is how the Zebra Bananza form will factor into a few puzzle types later on.

The Zebra Bananza has a few upgrades that will add moves to its base form, like a better charge attack and a drift-like attack as well. In certain, more open Sublayers of Donkey Kong Bananza , like the Hilltop Layer, the Zebra Bananza form does have its uses. Most areas are not well-suited for this power though. It’s not bad, but players should not waste too many Skill Points on upgrades, as there are better Bananza Powers for DK to master.

4 Snake Bananza

Bounce Up, Super Star

The Snake Bananza form will be the final one players unlock, and is located in the Radiance Layer. It’s a fun callback to Rattly the Rattlesnake, one of the mounts players can find in Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy’s Kong Quest, who excelled at high jumps. The Snake Bananza can give DK a double jump ability, and players can charge up the snake’s coil to bounce even higher. It can slow down time too, which is cool trick and useful for boss fights. Most upgrades will either make charged jumps faster or go higher, so there are not a lot of big extra moves to acquire here.

One upgrade in this form’s Skill Tree can make the downward punches in the Snake Bananza form stronger. Like the Zebra Bananza form, the Snake Bananza transformation has its uses, but they are not as widespread as the other forms. Also, it’s a bit hard to get around in this form unless players just use their double jump constantly. Perhaps if players could use the Snake Bananza form earlier in the game, it would be a better transformation with its skill upgrades, but it simply comes too late in Donkey Kong Bananza .

3 Ostrich Bananza

Fly, You Fool!

The Ostrich Bananza awaits players in the Forest Layer, as previously mentioned. This form is a game-changer because of its main ability: flight. Once players get the right upgrade, they can fly and glide over large areas. It can kind of break the game if players get to a high enough point, but that’s one of the best things about an open-world game with a flight mechanic.

Most of the Ostrich Bananza’s upgrades will boost the form's flight capabilities, but there’s also an odd attack upgrade wherein the form can drop eggs on enemies. It’s funny to use a few times, but it’s not the most useful attack power in the game. Overall, the Ostrich Bananza form is not that strong physically as a Bananza Power, but the ability to fly alone makes it a good middle-of-the-pack unlock. It can definitely help players to hard-to-reach places in Donkey Kong Bananza.

2 Elephant Bananza

Suck Till You Drop

The Elephant Bananza form can be found in the Tempest Layer. When players begin Donkey Kong Bananza , they will be surprised by the impressive physics in this open-world game with destructibility. They will be blown away again with the Elephant Bananza form because its main ability lies in its trunk, which can suck up materials in the blink of an eye. Those materials can then become objects that players can launch at enemies.

For example, players can suck up explosive materials like Gold or purple rocks to then launch for a chaotic effect. The ability to suck alone can create endless hours of fun. Most Skill Tree nodes will upgrade the trunk’s power, boosting its range and how fast it can vacuum up materials. The only downside is its flexibility, as it is the slowest Bananza form to move around in.

1 Kong Bananza

Going Ape

The Kong Bananza form will be the first upgrade players get for DK. This is also how Pauline gets freed from her Odd Rock form in Donkey Kong Bananza . It may not be as exciting as the ability to fly or suck up objects, but the Kong Bananza transformation is the strongest in the game by far. Some of the hardest rock layers can only be destroyed when DK is in this form.

For a game that's all about destruction, the Kong Bananza ability will give players exactly what they need. Once unlocked, it’s much more fun to go around destroying walls while looking for treasure. Upgrades aren’t that fantastical in the Kong Bananza's Skill Tree, but they will make the form better at destroying things, and that's what counts. There’s also an armor upgrade if players truly want to turn DK into a fuzzier version of The Hulk, which is useful against some of the game’s stronger bosses.

Your comment has not been saved
